meanings.definition: A contract granting use or occupation of property during a specified period in exchange for a specified rent.
meanings.sent1: The lease for the apartment was signed last week.
meanings.sent2: She read the lease carefully before moving in.
meanings.sent3: The lease for the haunted house came with a free ghost.
meanings.sent4: His lease on life seemed to be running out.
meanings.sent5: The lease agreement was as binding as a chain.

meanings.definition: To grant the possession and use of (property) in return for rental payment.
meanings.sent1: They decided to lease the car for a year.
meanings.sent2: He leased his land to farmers for cultivation.
meanings.sent3: She joked that she would lease the moon if she could.
meanings.sent4: His mind seemed to lease itself to creativity.
meanings.sent5: The idea of leasing happiness seemed absurd to him.

meanings.definition: A period of time during which a contract conveying property is in effect.
meanings.sent1: The lease of the house expires next month.
meanings.sent2: During the lease, the tenants are responsible for maintenance.
meanings.sent3: The lease on the car felt like a countdown to freedom.
meanings.sent4: Her lease on the office space was a ticket to success.
meanings.sent5: The lease period was as fleeting as a shooting star.
